name: Cobb Salad Dip
author: Yoly
summary: I recently went to a gathering and this was served there. I came home and tried my hand at making a similar dip. This has all the flavors of a Cobb salad in the form of a dip. Serve with chips, crackers, saltines, or crusty bread.
ingredients: ⅓ cup blue cheese dressing (such as Bob's Big Boy®)
¼ cup sliced green onions, green part only
directions: Combine Neufchatel cheese and blue cheese dressing
Spread onto a 9-inch pie plate and place in the refrigerator
Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Drain bacon slices on paper towels and let cool
Layer chopped lettuce over Neufchatel cheese mixture
Top with bacon, eggs, avocado, turkey breast, tomatoes, blue cheese crumbles, and green onions
